  9402 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9403                                  
  9404                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9405                                  
  9406                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9407                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9408                                  ; drive.
  9409                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9410                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9411                                  ; returns in si:
  9412                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9413                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9414                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9415                                  ;
  9416                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9417                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9418                                  
  9419                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9420                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9421 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9422 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9423 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9424                                  					; get stored time
  9425 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9426 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9427 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9428 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9429 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9430 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9431 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9432 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9433                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9434 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9435 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9436 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9437                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9438                                  
  9439                                  timepassed:				
  9440 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9441                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9442 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9443                                  
  9444                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9445                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9446 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9447                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9448 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9449                                  
  9450                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9451                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9452                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9453 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
  9454                                  
  9455                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9456                                  
  9457                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9458                                  
  9459                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9460                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9461                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9462                                  
  9463                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9464                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h

  9468                                  					; fnon_removable

  9478 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9479                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9480 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9481                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9482 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9483 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
  9484                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
  9485                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
  9486 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9487 000005B0 7403                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; brif not
  9488 000005B2 E86113                  		call	set_volume_id
  9489                                  already_gotbpb:

  9491                                  					; return the bpb from the current bds
  9492                                  
  9493                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result
  9494

  9498                                  
  9499                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9500                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9501                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9502                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
  9503                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
  9504                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
  9505                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway

  9525                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9526                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.

  9578                                  
  9579                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9580                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9581                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9582                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9583                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9584                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9585                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9586                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9587                                  ;
  9588                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9589                                  ;
  9590                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9591                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9592                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9593                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9594                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9595                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9596                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9597                                  ;
  9598                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9599                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9600                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9601                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9602                                  
  9603                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9604                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9605 000005F7 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9606 000005FC 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9607 000005FE E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit
  9608                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9609                                  
  9610                                  getbp1:					
  9611 00000601 51                      		push	cx
  9612 00000602 52                      		push	dx
  9613 00000603 53                      		push	bx
  9614                                  
  9615                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9616                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9617                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9618                                  
  9619 00000604 E8A400                  		call	readbootsec
  9620 00000607 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9621 00000609 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9622 0000060B 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9623 0000060D E8F000                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9624 00000610 EB57                    		jmp	short Has1
  9625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9626                                  
  9627                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:			
  9628 00000612 E98200                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret
  9629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9630                                  
  9631                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
  9632                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
  9633                                  dofatbpb:				
  9634 00000615 E85401                  		call	readfat		; puts media descriptor	byte in	ah
  9635 00000618 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg
  9636                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	;  changeline support available?
  9637 0000061A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; 19/10/2022

  9639 00000621 E88D12                  		call	hidensity	; may not return! May add sp, 2	and
  9640                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K

  9653                                  		; driver.sys is loaded since the bds is inside the driver.sys.

  9663                                  		;db	8Ah, 87h, 0, 0	; mov al, [bx+0]

  9743                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9744                                  
  9745                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9746                                  
  9747                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9748                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9749                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9750                                  ;
  9751                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9752                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9753                                  
  9754                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9755                                  
  9756                                  readbootsec:	
  9757 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9758 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9759 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9760 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9761 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9762                                  
  9763                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9764                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9765                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9766                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9767                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9768                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9769                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9770                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9771                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9772                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9773                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9774                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9775                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9776                                  		; informations
  9777                                  
  9778                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9779                                  
  9780                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9781 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9782 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9783 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9784 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9785 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9786 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9787 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9788 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9789                                  
  9790                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9791                                  ;
  9792                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9793                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9794                                  ;;
  9795                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9796                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9797                                  ;;
  9798                                  ;;check_signature:
  9799                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9800                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9801                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9802                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9803                                  
  9804                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9805                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9806                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9807                                  
  9808                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9809                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9810 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9811                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9812 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9813 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9814 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9815                                  
  9816                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9817                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9818                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9819                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9820                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9821                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9822                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9823                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9824                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9825                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9826                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9827                                  
  9828                                  checksinglesided:
  9829 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9830 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9831 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9832 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9833 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9834 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9835 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9836 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9837 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9838                                  
  9839                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9840                                  
  9841                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9842 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9843                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9844 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9845                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9846                                  
  9847                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9848 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9849                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9850                                  movbpb_ret:
  9851                                  gooddsk:				
  9852 000006FE F8                      		clc
  9853                                  err_ret:
  9854 000006FF C3                      		retn
  9855                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9856                                  
  9857                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9858                                  ;err_ret:				
  9859                                  		;retn
  9860                                  
  9861                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9862                                  
  9863                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9864                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9865                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9866                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9867                                  ;
  9868                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9869                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9870                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9871                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9872                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9873                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9874                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9875                                  
  9876                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9877                                  
  9878                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9879                                  movbpb:	
  9880 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9881                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9882                                  					; sectors per unit
  9883 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9884                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9885                                  					; number of directory entries
  9886 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9887                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9888                                  					; size of drive
  9889 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9890                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9891                                  					; media	descriptor
  9892 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9893                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9894                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9895 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9896                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9897                                  					; sectors per track
  9898 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9899                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9900                                  					; number of heads
  9901 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9902 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9903 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9904 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9905 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9906                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9907 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9908 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9909 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9910                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9911                                  		; cf = 0
  9912                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9913                                  		;clc
  9914 00000736 C3                      		retn
  9915                                  
  9916                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9917                                  
  9918                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9919                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9920                                  ;by es:di.
  9921                                  
  9922                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9923                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9924                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9925                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9926                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9927                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9928                                  
  9929                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9930                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9931 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9932                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9933                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9934 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9935 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
  9936 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9937                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9938 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9939 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9940                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9941 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9942 0000074F 57                      		push	di
  9943 00000750 56                      		push	si
  9944 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9945 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
  9946                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
  9947                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
  9948 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9949 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9950                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9951                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9952 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
  9953 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
  9954                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
  9955 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9956 00000764 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9957 00000766 5E                      		pop	si
  9958 00000767 5F                      		pop	di
  9959 00000768 59                      		pop	cx
  9960                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9961                                  		; cf = 0
  9962                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
  9963                                  				; (20/09/2022)
  9964 00000769 C3                      		retn
  9965                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9966                                  
  9967                                  mmi_not_ext:				
  9968 0000076A F9                      		stc
  9969 0000076B C3                      		retn
  9970                                  
  9971                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9972                                  
  9973                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9974                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
  9975                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
  9976                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
  9977                                  ; output:
  9978                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
  9979                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
  9980                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
  9981                                  
  9982                                  readfat:	
  9983                                  		;mov	dh, 0
  9984                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9985 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  9986 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
  9987                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
  9988 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
  9989 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
  9990 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
  9991                                  bad_fat_ret:				
  9992 00000778 C3                      		retn
  9993                                  
  9994                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9995                                  
  9996                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9997                                  
  9998                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9999                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10000                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10001                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10002                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10003                                  ;		dh has head
 10004                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10005                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10006                                  ;
 10007                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10008                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10009                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10010                                  ;
 10011                                  ;		carry set
 10012                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10013                                  ;
 10014                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10015                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10016                                  
 10017                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10018                                  
 10019                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10020                                  read_sector:	
 10021 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10022 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10023 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10024 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10025                                  rd_ret:					
 10026 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10027 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10028 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10029 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10030 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10031                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10032                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10033                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10034 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10035 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10036                                  rd_rty:					
 10037 0000078F E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10038 00000792 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10039 00000794 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10040                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10041                                  					; fnon_removable
 10042 00000799 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10043 0000079B 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10044 000007A0 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10045 000007A2 50                      		push	ax
 10046 000007A3 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10047 000007A4 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10048                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10049                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10050                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10051                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10052 000007A8 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10053 000007AA 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10054                                  		; 
 10055 000007AD 1F                      		pop	ds
 10056 000007AE A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10057 000007B1 58                      		pop	ax
 10058                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10059 000007B2 06                      		push	es
 10060 000007B3 1E                      		push	ds
 10061 000007B4 07                      		pop	es
 10062 000007B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10063 000007B8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10064                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10065                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10066                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10067 000007BA 07                      		pop	es
 10068 000007BB 9C                      		pushf
 10069 000007BC 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10070 000007C1 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10071 000007C3 50                      		push	ax
 10072 000007C4 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10073 000007C7 1E                      		push	ds
 10074 000007C8 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10075 000007CC 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10076 000007CF 1F                      		pop	ds
 10077 000007D0 58                      		pop	ax
 10078                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10079 000007D1 9D                      		popf
 10080 000007D2 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10081 000007D4 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10082                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10083                                  
 10084                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10085 000007D6 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10086                                  					; return error
 10087 000007D8 F9                      		stc
 10088                                  
 10089                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10090                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10091                                  
 10092                                  okret2:					
 10093 000007D9 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10094 000007DD 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10095 000007E1 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10096                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10097                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10098 000007E5 9C                      		pushf
 10099 000007E6 E8FF03                  		call	set_tim
 10100 000007E9 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10101 000007EA 5D                      		pop	bp
 10102 000007EB C3                      		retn
 10103

 10108                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah

 10195                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10196                                  
 10197                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10198                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10199                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10200                                  
 10201                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10202                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10203                                  ;
 10204                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10205                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10206                                  
 10207                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10208                                  checksingle:		
 10209 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10210 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10211 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10212                                  
 10213                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10214                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10215                                  
 10216 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10217 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10218 00000846 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10219                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10220 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10221                                  
 10222                                  
 10223                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10224                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10225                                  
 10226 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10227                                  					; get physical drive number
 10228 0000084F 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10229 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10230 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10231                                  scan_list:				
 10232 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10233 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10234 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10235 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10236 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10237 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10238 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10239 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10240 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10241                                  
 10242                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10243                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10244                                  ; in this case.
 10245 0000086D 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10246 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10247                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10248 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10249 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10250 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10251                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10252                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10253 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10254 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10255 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10256                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10257                                  					; set up sdsb
 10258 00000888 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10259 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10260                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10261                                  
 10262                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10263                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10264                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10265                                  
 10266                                  not_fsetowner:

 10268 00000890 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10269 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10270 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10271 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10272 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10273 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10274 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10275                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10276                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10277 000008A3 07                      		pop	es
 10278 000008A4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10279 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10280 000008A7 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10281                                  ignore_sdsb:

 10283 000008AC EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10284                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10285                                  
 10286                                  scan_skip:

 10289                                  					; go to	next bds
 10290 000008B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10291 000008B4 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10292 000008B6 F9                      		stc
 10293 000008B7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10294 000008B8 07                      		pop	es
 10295                                  
 10296                                  singleret:

 10298 000008BA 58                      		pop	ax

 10302

 10305 000008BE EB02                    		jmp	short baddrive_ret

 10307                                  
 10308                                  unformatteddrive:

 10317                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10318                                  
 10319                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10320                                  
 10321                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10322                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10323                                  ;
 10324                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10325                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10326                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10327                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10328                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10329                                  ;	ds = cs
 10330                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10331                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10332                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10333                                  ;
 10334                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10335                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10336                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10337                                  
 10338                                  diskrd:	
 10339                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10340                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10341 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10342                                  
 10343                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10344                                  
 10345                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10346                                  diskio:
 10347 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10348 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10349 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10350 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10351 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10352                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10353 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10354                                  
 10355                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10356                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10357                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10358                                  
 10359 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10360                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10361                                  					; unformatted_media
 10362 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10363 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10364 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10365                                  
 10366                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10367                                  
 10368 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10369 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10370 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10371 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10372 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10373                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?

 10375 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10376 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10377 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10378 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10379 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10380                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10381                                  
 10382                                  sanity32:				
 10383 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10384 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10385 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10386 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10387 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10388 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10389                                  
 10390                                  sanityok:				
 10391 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10392 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10393 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10394                                  
 10395                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10396                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10397                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10398                                  
 10399 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10400                                  
 10401                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10402                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10403                                  
 10404 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10405 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10406 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10407                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10408                                  					; current disk parm table
 10409 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10410 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10411 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10412 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10413                                  					; fnon_removable
 10414 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10415 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10416                                  
 10417                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10418                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10419                                  ; the proper error code.
 10420                                  
 10421 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10422 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10423 0000094C E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10424                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10425                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10426 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10427                                  
 10428                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10429                                  
 10430                                  skip_setup:
 10431                                  
 10432                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10433                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10434                                  				
 10435 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10436 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10437 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10438                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10439 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10440 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10441 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10442                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10443                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10444                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10445 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10446 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10447 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10448                                  					; get number of	heads
 10449 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10450 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10451 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10452 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10453 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10454 00000978 58                      		pop	ax
 10455 00000979 F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10456 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10457 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10458 00000982 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10459 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg

 10461 0000098B A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10462                                  
 10463                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10464                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10465                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10466

 10468 00000991 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)

 10470                                  		;retn
 10471                                  		; 18/12/2022

 10475

 10480                                  
 10481                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10482                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 10483                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 10484                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 10485                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 10486                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 10487                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10488                                  
 10489                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10490                                  iosetup:	
 10491 00000999 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10492 0000099D A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 10493                                  
 10494                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 10495                                  
 10496 000009A0 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10497 000009A5 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting

 10499 000009AA 1E                      		push	ds
 10500 000009AB C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10501 000009AF 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 10502 000009B2 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]

 10506 000009BC 8826[2B01]              		mov	[save_eot], ah
 10507                                  
 10508                                  ; for 3.5" drives, both external as well as on the k09, we need to set the
 10509                                  ; motor start time to 4. this checking for every i/o is going to affect
 10510                                  ; performance across the board, but is necessary!!
 10511

 10515                                  					; ffSmall

 10518 000009CE 86440A                  		xchg	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10519                                  motor_start_ok:
 10520

 10522                                  ; get current settle and set fast settle

 10530                                  					; get settle and set up	for fast

 10534                                  					; someone has diddled the settle
 10535 000009DD A2[2801]                		mov	[settleslow], al
 10536                                  skip_dpt_setting:

 10538                                  
 10539                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10540                                  
 10541                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10542                                  ; set time of last access, and reset default values in the dpt.
 10543                                  ;
 10544                                  ;	  note: trashes (at least) si
 10545                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10546

 10548                                  done:

 10552 000009E8 E8FD01                  		call	set_tim

 10555                                  diddle_back:

 10575

 10577                                  
 10578                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10579                                  ;read the number of sectors specified in ax,

 10606
