 12938                                  
 12939                                  ; 17/10/2022
 12940                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12941                                  
 12942                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 12943                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 12944                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 12945                                  
 12946                                  win386call:				
 12947 00001340 1E                      		push	ds
 12948 00001341 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 12949                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 12950                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 12951 00001346 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 12952                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 12953 00001348 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 12954 0000134A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 12955                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 12956 0000134C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 12957                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12958 0000134E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 12959                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 12960 00001351 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 12961                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 12962 00001353 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 12963 00001358 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 12964                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12965                                  
 12966                                  Win386Init:	
 12967                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12968 0000135A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 12969                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 12970 0000135D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 12971                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 12972 0000135F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 12973                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 12974                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 12975 00001364 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 12976 00001368 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 12977                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 12978 0000136C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 12979 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 12980 00001370 07                      		pop	es
 12981                                  win_iret:				
 12982 00001371 1F                      		pop	ds
 12983                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 12984 00001372 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 12985                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12986                                  
 12987                                  handle_multmult:			
 12988 00001374 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 12989 00001376 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 12990 00001378 1E                      		push	ds
 12991 00001379 E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 12992                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12993                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 12994                                  		;dec	bx
 12995 0000137C BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 12996 0000137F 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 12997 00001381 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 12998 00001383 F7D3                    		not	bx
 12999 00001385 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13000 00001387 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13001 00001389 43                      		inc	bx
 13002                                  try_1:					
 13003 0000138A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13004 0000138B EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13005                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13006                                  
 13007                                  try_2:					
 13008 0000138D 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13009 0000138F 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13010 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13011                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13012                                  		;xor	di, di
 13013                                  		;dec	di
 13014 00001392 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13015 00001395 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13016 00001397 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13017 0000139A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13018 0000139D 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13019 0000139F F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13020 000013A1 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13021 000013A3 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13022                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13023                                  		;sub	di, di
 13024                                  		;dec	di
 13025 000013A5 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13026 000013A8 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13028                                  
 13029                                  try_4:					
 13030                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13031 000013AA 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13032 000013AE 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13033                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13034                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13035 000013B1 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13036                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13037 000013B4 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13038 000013B8 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13039 000013BA C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13040                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13041                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13042                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13043 000013C0 1F                      		pop	ds
 13044                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13045                                  try_3:		
 13046 000013C1 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13047                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13048                                  
 13049                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13050                                  ;try_3:					
 13051                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13052                                  
 13053                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13054                                  
 13055                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13056                                  
 13057                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13058                                  ;
 13059                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13060                                  ;
 13061                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13062                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13063                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13064                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13065                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13066                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13067                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13068                                  ;
 13069                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13070                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13071                                  ;
 13072                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13073                                  
 13074                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13075                                  HMAPtr:
 13076 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13077                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13078 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13079                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13080 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13081 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13082 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13083                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13084 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13085 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13086                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13087 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13088                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13089                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13090 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13091                                  
 13092                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13093                                  
 13094                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13095                                  
 13096                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13097                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13098                                  
 13099                                  move_sector:
 13100                                  
 13101                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13102                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13103                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13104                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13105                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13106                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13107                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13108                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13109                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13110                                  ;
 13111                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13112                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13113                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13114                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13115                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13116                                  
 13117 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13118 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13119 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13120 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13121 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13122 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13123 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13124 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13125 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13126 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13127                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13128                                  
 13129                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13130 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13131 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13132 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13133 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13134                                  
 13135                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13136                                  
 13137                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13138                                  
 13139                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13140                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13141                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13142                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13143                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13144                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13145                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13146                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13147                                  ;
 13148                                  ; input conditions:
 13149                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13150                                  ;
 13151                                  ; output:
 13152                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13153                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13154                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13155                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13156                                  
 13157                                  check_wrap:	
 13158 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13159 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13160 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13161 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13162 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13163 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13164                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13165 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13166                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13167 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13168 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13169 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13170 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13171 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13172 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13173 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13174                                  
 13175                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13176                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13177                                  
 13178 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13179 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13180                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13181 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13182 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13183                                  					; if on	boundary
 13184                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13185                                  not_on_bound:				
 13186 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13187 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13188 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13189 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13190 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13191 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13192 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13193                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13194 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13195 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13196 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13197 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13198 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13199                                  
 13200                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13201                                  
 13202 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13203 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13204 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13205                                  
 13206                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13207                                  
 13208 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13209 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13210 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13211                                  no_head_bound:				
 13212 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13213 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13214 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13215 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13216 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13217 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13218 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13219 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13220 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13221 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13222 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13223 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13224 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13225 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13226                                  no_wrap:				
 13227 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13228 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13229 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13230 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13231 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13232 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13233                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13234                                  
 13235                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13236 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13237 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13238 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13239                                  
 13240                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13241                                  
 13242                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13243                                  
 13244                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13245                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13246                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13247                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13248                                  ;
 13249                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13250                                  
 13251                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13252                                  find_bds:	
 13253 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13254                                  fbds_1:					
 13255 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13256 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13257 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13258                                  					; go to next bds
 13259 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13260 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13261 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13262                                  fdbs_2:					
 13263 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13264                                  
 13265                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13266                                  
 13267                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13268                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13269                                  doint:
 13270                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13271 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13272                                  					; get physical drive number
 13273                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13274                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13275                                  		
 13276 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13277 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13278 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13279                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13280 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13281                                  					; get request code
 13282                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13283 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13284                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13285 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13286                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13287                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13288 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13289                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13290                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13291 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13292                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13293 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13294                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13295                                  dointdone:				
 13296 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13297                                  
 13298                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13299                                  
 13300                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13301                                  
 13302                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13303                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13304                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13305                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13306                                  ;
 13307                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13308                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13309                                  ;
 13310                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13311                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13312                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13313                                  
 13314                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13315                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13316                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13317                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13318                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13319                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13320                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13321                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13322                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13323                                  ;end struc
 13324                                  
 13325                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13326                                  
 13327                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13328                                  ;	ah = function
 13329                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13330                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13331                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13332                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13333                                  ;   output conditions:
 13334                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13335                                  
 13336                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13337                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13338                                  ;
 13339                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13340                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13341                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13342                                  
 13343                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13344                                  
 13345                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13346                                  
 13347 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13348                                  
 13349                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13350                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13351                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13352                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13353                                  
 13354                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13355                                  
 13356                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13357                                  
 13358                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13359                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13360                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13361                                  
 13362                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13363 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13364 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13365 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13366 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13367 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13368 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13369 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13370                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13371                                  
 13372                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13373                                  
 13374                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13375                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13376                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13377                                  
 13378                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13379                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13380 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13381 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13382 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13383 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13384 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13385 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13386 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13387 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13388 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13389 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13390 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13391                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13392 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13393 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13394                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13395 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13396                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13397                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13398 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13399 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13400 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13401                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13402                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13403 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13404 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13405 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13406                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13407                                  
 13408                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13409                                  
 13410                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13411                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13412                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13413                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13414                                  
 13415                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13416 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13417                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13418 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13419 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13420                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13421 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13422                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13423 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13424 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13425                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13426                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13427 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13428                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13429                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13430 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13431 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13432                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13433                                  
 13434                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13435                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13436                                  
 13437                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13438                                  
 13439                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13440                                  
 13441                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13442                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13443                                  
 13444                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13445 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13446                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13447                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13448 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13449                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13450                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13451                                  
 13452                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13453                                  
 13454 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13455 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13456 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13457                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13458                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13459 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13460 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13461                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13462                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13463                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13464 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13465                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13466                                  		
 13467 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13468                                  		
 13469 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13470                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13471 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13472                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13473                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13474 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13475 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13476                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13477 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13478 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13479                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13480                                  
 13481                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13482                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13483                                  ; a changeline error.
 13484                                  
 13485                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13486 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13487                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13488 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13489 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13490 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13491 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13492 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13493 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13494                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13495                                  					; never	would
 13496 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13497 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13498 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13499 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13500                                  int13b:					
 13501 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13502 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13503                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13504                                  
 13505                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13506                                  
 13507                                  goterr13:				
 13508 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13509 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13510                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13511 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13512 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13513 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13514 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13515                                  
 13516 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13517                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13518                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13519                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13520 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13521                                  
 13522 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13523                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13524                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13525 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13526                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13527                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13528 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13529 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13530 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13531 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13532 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13533 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13534 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13535 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13536                                  loop_ecc:				
 13537 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13538                                  
 13539                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13540                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13541                                  ;
 13542                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13543                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13544                                  ; track.
 13545                                  ;
 13546                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13547                                  ; this request.
 13548                                  ;
 13549                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13550                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13551                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13552                                  ;
 13553 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13554                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13555                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13556 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13557                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13558 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13559 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13560 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13561 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13562 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13563                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13564                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13565                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13566 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13567                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13568                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13569                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13570                                  ok11_op:				
 13571 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13572 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13573 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13574                                  					; add 200h to address
 13575 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13576 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13577 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13579                                  
 13580                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13581                                  
 13582                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13583 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13584                                  ok11_exit:				
 13585 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13586 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13587 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13588 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13589                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13590                                  
 13591                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13592                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13593                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13594                                  
 13595                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13596 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13597 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13598 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13599 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13600 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13601 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13602                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13603                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13604 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13605                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13606 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13607 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13608 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13609 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13610 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13611                                  
 13612                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13613                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13614                                  
 13615                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13616 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13617 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13618 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13619 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13620 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13621 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13622 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13623 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13624                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13625                                  
 13626                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13627                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13628                                  
 13629                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13630 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13631 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13632 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13633 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13634                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13635                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13636 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13637 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13638 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13639 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13640 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13641                                  
 13642                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13643                                  
 13644                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13645                                  
 13646 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13647 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13648 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13649 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13650 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13651 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13652 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13653 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13654 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13655 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13656 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13657 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13658 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13659                                  
 13660                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13661                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13662                                  
 13663 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13664 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13665                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13666                                  
 13667                                  no_skip_first:				
 13668 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13669 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13670 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13671                                  
 13672                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13673                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13674                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13675                                  ;
 13676                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13677                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13678                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13679                                  ; in error.
 13680                                  
 13681 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13682 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13683                                  
 13684                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13685                                  
 13686 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13687                                  					; set up head number
 13688 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13689 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13690                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13691                                  
 13692                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13693 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13694 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13695 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13696                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13697                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13698                                  
 13699                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13700                                  
 13701                                  intverify:				
 13702 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13703 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13704 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13705 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13706                                  dosimple:				
 13707 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13708                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13709                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13710                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13711 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13712                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13713 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13714 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13715 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13716                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13717                                  
 13718                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13719                                  
 13720                                  intformat:				
 13721 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13722 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13723 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13724 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13725 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13726                                  
 13727                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13728                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13729                                  
 13730 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13731 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13732 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13733 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13734 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13735 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13736 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13737 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13738 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13739 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13740 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13741                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13742                                  
 13743                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13744                                  ; the first block.
 13745                                  ;
 13746                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13747                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13748                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13749                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13750                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13751                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13752                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13753                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13754                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13755                                  
 13756                                  doblock:
 13757                                  
 13758                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13759                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13760                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13761                                  				
 13762 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13763                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13764 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13765 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13766 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13767                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13768 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13769 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13770                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13771 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13772                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13773 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13774 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13775 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13776 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13777 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13778 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13779                                  doblockflop:				
 13780 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13781                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13782 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13783 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13784 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13785 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13786 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13787                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13788                                  
 13789                                  doblocklast:				
 13790 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13791 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13792                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13793 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13794 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13795 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13796 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13797                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13798 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13799 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13800 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13801 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13802 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13803                                  					; then we are done already.
 13804 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13805                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13806 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13807 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13808                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13809                                  
 13810                                  bufferx:				
 13811 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13812                                  					; set up head number
 13813                                  buffer:					
 13814 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13815 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13816 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13817 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13818                                  					
 13819                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13820                                  
 13821 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13822 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13823 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13824 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13825 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13826 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13827 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13828 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13829 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13830 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13831 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13832 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13833 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13834                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13835 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13836 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13837 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13838                                  
 13839                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13840                                  
 13841 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13842                                  					; get drive number
 13843 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13844 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13845                                  					;
 13846                                  					; ah is	function
 13847                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13848                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13849                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13850                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13851                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13852 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13853 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13854 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13855 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13856                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13857                                  
 13858                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13859                                  
 13860                                  doread:					
 13861 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13862 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13863 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13864 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13865 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13866 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13867 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13868                                  					; get drive number
 13869 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13870                                  					; ah = function
 13871                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13872                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13873                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13874 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13875 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13876 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13877 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13878 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13879 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13880 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13881 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13882 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13883 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13884 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13885                                  
 13886                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13887                                  
 13888                                  dotail:					
 13889 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13890 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13891 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13892 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13893 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13894 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13895 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13896                                  
 13897                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13898                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13899                                  
 13900 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13901 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13902 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13903                                  
 13904                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13905                                  
 13906                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13907                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13908                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13909                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13910                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13911                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13912                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13913                                  
 13914                                  bad13:					
 13915 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13916 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13917 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13918 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13919 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13920 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13921 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13922 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13923                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13924                                  
 13925                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13926 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13927                                  
 13928                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13929                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13930                                  		;db 	0
 13931                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13932                                  
 13933                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 13934

 13943                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13944 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13945 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13946 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 13947 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 13948 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 13949                                  
 13950                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13951                                  
 13952                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13953                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 13954                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 13955                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 13956                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13957                                  
 13958                                  install_bds:		
 13959 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 13960 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 13961                                  
 13962                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 13963                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 13964                                  loop_next_bds:				
 13965 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 13966                                  					; fetch	next bds
 13967 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13968 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 13969                                  					; drive	with new one?
 13970 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 13971 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 13972 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13973                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 13974 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13975 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 13976                                  					; we don't own it
 13977 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13978                                  					; determine if changeline available
 13979 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 13980 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13981                                  next_bds:				
 13982 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 13983                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 13984 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 13985 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 13986                                  					; install bds
 13987 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 13988 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 13989                                  					; set next pointer to null
 13990 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13991                                  
 13992                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 13993                                  ;
 13994                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 13995                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 13996                                  ;
 13997                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 13998                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 13999                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14000                                  ;
 14001                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14002                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14003                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14004                                  
 14005 0000172B C3                      		retn

 14025 0000172C F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1

 14112                                  ; input : es:di points to current bds for drive.
 14113                                  ; return : zero set if no open files
