 15180                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15181                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15182                                  
 15183                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15184                                  
 15185                                  struc buffinfo
 15186 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15187 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15188 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15189                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15190                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15191 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15192                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15193                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15194                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15195                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15196                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15197                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15198                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15199                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15200 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15201                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15202 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15203 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15204 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15205 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15206 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15207                                  .size:
 15208                                  endstruc
 15209                                  
 15210                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15211                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15212                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15213                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15214                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15215                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15216                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15217                                  
 15218                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15219                                  
 15220                                  
 15221                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15222                                  
 15223                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15224                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15225                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15226                                  ;***
 15227                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15228                                  ;***
 15229                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15230                                  
 15231                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15232                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15233                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15234                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15235                                  
 15236                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15239                                  
 15240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15241                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15242                                  
 15243                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15244                                  
 15245                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15246                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15247                                  ;
 15248                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15249                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15250                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15251                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15252                                  ;
 15253                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15254                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15255                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15256                                  
 15257                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15258                                  
 15259                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15260                                  
 15261                                  struc	DPB
 15262 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15263 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15264 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15265 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15266 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15267 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15268 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15269 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15270 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15271 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15272                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15273 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15274 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15275 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15276 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15277 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15278                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15279 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15280 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15281 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15282                                  .size:
 15283                                  endstruc
 15284                                  
 15285                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15286                                  
 15287                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15288

 15344                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15345                                  
 15346                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15347                                  ;
 15348                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15349                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15350                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15351                                  ;
 15352                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15353                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15354                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15355                                  ;
 15356                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15357                                  
 15358                                  struc A_BPB
 15359 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15360 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15361 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15362 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15363 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15364 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15365 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15366 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15367 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15368 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15369 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15370 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15371 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15372 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15373 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15374                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15375                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15376                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15377                                  .size:
 15378                                  endstruc
 15379                                  
 15380                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15381 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15382 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15383 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15384 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15385 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15386 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15387 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15388 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size

 15637                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15638                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15639                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15640                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15641                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15642                                  									  
 15643                                  ;*******************************					  
 15644                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15645                                  ;*******************************					  
 15646                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15647                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15648                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15649                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15650                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15651                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15652                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15653                                  ;For all others:							  
 15654                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15655                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15656                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15657                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15658                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15659                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15660                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15661                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15662                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15663                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15664                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15665                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15666                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15667                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15668                                  ;									  
 15669                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15670                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15671                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15672                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15673                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15674                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15675                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15676                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15677                                  ;									  
 15678                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15679                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15680                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15681                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15682                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15683                                  ;									  
 15684                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15685                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15686                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15687                                  ;									  
 15688                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15689                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15690                                  ;									  
 15691                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15692                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15693                                  ;									  
 15694                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15695                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15696                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15697                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15698                                  ;						called. 		  
 15699                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15700                                  ;									  
 15701                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15702                                  ;									  
 15703                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15704                                  ;									  
 15705                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15706                                  ;									  
 15707                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15708                                  ;									  
 15709                                  
 15710                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15711                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15712 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15713 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15714                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15715 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15716 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15717 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15718 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15719                                  endstruc

 15828                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15829                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15830                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15831                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15832                                  
 15833                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15834                                  ;
 15835                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15836                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15837                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15838                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15839                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15840                                  ;
 15841                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15842                                  ;
 15843                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15844                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15845                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15846                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15847                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15848                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15849                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15850                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15851                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15852                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15853                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15854                                  
 15855                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15856                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15857                                  
 15858                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15859                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15860 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15861 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15862 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15863 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15864 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15865 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15866                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15867 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15868 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15869 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15870                                  .size:
 15871                                  endstruc
 15872                                  
 15873                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15874                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15875                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15876                                  						; argument
 15877                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15878

 15880

 15888                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15889                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15890                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15891                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15892                                  
 15893                                  ; system file table
 15894                                  
 15895                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15896                                  ;
 15897                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15898                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15899                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15900                                  
 15901                                  struc	SF
 15902 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15903 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15904 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15905                                  .size:
 15906                                  endstruc
 15907                                  
 15908                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15909                                  ;
 15910                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15911                                  
 15912                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15913 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15914                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15915 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15916 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15917 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15918                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15919                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15920                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15921                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15922                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15923                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15924                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15925                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15926                                  					;
 15927                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15928                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15929                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15930                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15931                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15932                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15933                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15934                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15935                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15936                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15937                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15938                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15939 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15940                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15941                                  					; points to net device header if
 15942                                  					; remote
 15943 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15944                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 15945 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 15946 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 15947 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 15948 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 15949                                  ;
 15950                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 15951                                  ; ID
 15952                                  ;
 15953 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 15954 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 15955 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 15956                                  ;
 15957                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 15958                                  ;
 15959 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 15960                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 15961                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 15962                                  					; disk changed errors.
 15963                                  ; SHARING INFO
 15964 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 15965 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1

 16242                                  SYSINIT$:
 16243                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16244                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 16245                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message

 16249                                  
 16250                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16251                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16252                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16253                                  
 16254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16255                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16256                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16257                                  
 16258                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16259                                  ;
 16260                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16261                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16262                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16263                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16264                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16265                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16266                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16267                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16268                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16269                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16270                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16271                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16272                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16273                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16274                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16275                                  ;
 16276                                  
 16277                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16278                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16279                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16280                                  ;
 16281                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16282                                  ;
 16283                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16284                                  ;
 16285                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16286                                  ;
 16287                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16288                                  ;
 16289                                  
 16290                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16291                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16292                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16293                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16294                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16295                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16296                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16297                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16298                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16299                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16300                                  
 16301                                  		;EVEN
 16302                                  ;align 2
 16303                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16304                                  
 16305 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16306 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16307 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16308 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16309 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16310 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16311                                  
 16312 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16313 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16314 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16315                                  
 16316                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16317                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16318                                  
 16319                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16320                                  
 16321 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16322                                  
 16323                                  int02:
 16324                                  
 16325                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16326                                  ;
 16327                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16328                                  ;
 16329                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16330                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16331                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16332                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16333                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16334                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16335                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16336                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16337                                  ;
 16338                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16339                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16340                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16341                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16342                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16343                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16344                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16345                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16346                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16347                                  ;
 16348                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16349                                  
 16350 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16351 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16352 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16353 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16354                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16355 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16356 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16357 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16358                                  
 16359 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16360                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16361                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16362                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16363                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16364 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16365 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16366                                  special02:
 16367 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16368 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16369                                  normal02:

 16371 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks

 16599                                  
 16600                                  ;********************************************************************
 16601                                  ;common routines
 16602                                  ;********************************************************************
 16603                                  
 16604                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16605                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16606                                  ; service routine
 16607                                  
 16608                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16609                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16610                                  
 16611                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16612                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16613                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16614                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16615                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16616                                  
 16617                                  do_int_stacks:
 16618 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16619 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16620 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16621 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16622 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16623 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16624                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16625                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16626                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16627 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16628 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16629 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16630                                  
 16631 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16632                                  
 16633                                  found02:
 16634 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16635 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16636                                  
 16637 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16638                                  
 16639 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16640                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16641                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16642                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16643                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16644 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16645 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16646                                  
 16647                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16648                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16649                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16650                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16651                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16652                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16653                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16654                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16655                                  
 16656                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16657 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16658 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16659 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16660 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16661 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16662 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16663 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16664 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16665                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16666                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16667 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16668                                  
 16669 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16670                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16671 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16672                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16673                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16674                                  
 16675 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16676                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16677 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16678                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16679                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16680 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16681 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16682                                  
 16683                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16684                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16685                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16686 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16687 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16688                                  
 16689 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16690 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16691 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16692 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16693 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16694                                  
 16695                                  notfree02:
 16696 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16697 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16698                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16699                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16700                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16701 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16702                                  
 16703                                  findnext02:
 16704 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16705 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16706                                  
 16707                                  foundbad02:
 16708 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16709 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16710 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16711                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16712                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16713                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16714 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16715 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16716                                  
 16717                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16718                                  
 16719                                  ; Common routines
 16720                                  
 16721                                  longpath:
 16722                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16723 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16724                                  lploopp:
 16725                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16726                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16727                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16728 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16729 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16730                                  
 16731 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16732                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16733                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16734                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16735 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16736 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16737 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16738                                  
 16739 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16740 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16741                                  
 16742                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16743                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16744                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16745 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16746                                  inuse:
 16747 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16748 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16749 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16750 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16751                                  found:
 16752 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16753                                  fatal:

 16756 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16757 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16758 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16759 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16760                                  
 16761 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16762 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16763

 16766 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints

 17463                                  ; This call to DOSINIT will relocate the DOS data from its present location
 17464                                  ; at the top of memory, to its final location in low memory just above the
 17465                                  ; BIOS data. It will then build important DOS data structures in low 
 17466                                  ; memory following the DOS data. It returns (among many other things) the
 17467                                  ; new starting address of free memory.

 17956                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 17957                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 17958                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 17959                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 17960                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 17961                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 17962                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 17963                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 17964                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 17965                                  ;
 17966                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 17967                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 17968                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 17969                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 17970                                  ; been patched.

 18256 000007DD BA[5E34]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18257                                  
 18258                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18259                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18260                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18261                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18262                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18263                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18264                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18265                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18266                                  
 18267                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18268

 18270 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18273 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC

 18276

 18280 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx

 18282                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18283                                  
 18284                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18285                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18286                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18287                                  
 18288                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18289                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18291 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18292                                  
 18293                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18294                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18295                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18296                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18297                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18298                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18299                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18300                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18301                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18302                                  ;
 18303                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18304                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18305                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18306                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18307                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18308                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18309                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18310

 18555                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18556                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18557                                  ;
 18558                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18559                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18560                                  ;
 18561                                  ; Inputs : None
 18562                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18563                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18564                                  ;	   free memory.
 18565                                  ;
 18566                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18567                                  ;
 18568                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18569                                  
 18570                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18575 0000085D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18576 0000085F CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 18577                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18578                                  	; ds = cs
 18579                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 18580                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 18581 00000861 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 18582 00000864 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 18583 00000867 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory

 18651                                  ;
 18652                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18653                                  ;
 18654                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18655                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18656                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18657                                  ;
 18658                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18659                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18660                                  ; 
 18661                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18662                                  
 18663                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18664                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18665                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 18666                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18667                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18668                                  	; ds = cs

 18670 000008E0 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 18671                                  
 18672                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18673                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18674                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18675                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18676                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18677                                  	; ds = cs
 18678 000008E2 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 18679                                  ;else
 18680                                  ;	..
 18681                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18682                                  
 18683                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18684                                  	; ds = cs
 18685 000008E6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 18686                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 18687 000008E8 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 18688                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1

 18691                                  ttldhx:
 18692 000008F2 C3                      	retn

 18694                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18695                                  ;
 18696                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18697                                  ;
 18698                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18699                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18700                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18701                                  ;
 18702                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18703                                  ;
 18704                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18705                                  
 18706                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18707                                  MovDOSHi:
 18708                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18709                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18710                                  	; ds = cs
 18711 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18712 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18713 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18714 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18715                                  
 18716                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18717                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18718                                  
 18719                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18720                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18721                                  	
 18722                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18723 000008FD E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18724                                  
 18725                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18726                                  	
 18727                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18728                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18729                                  	;xor	di,di
 18730                                  	
 18731                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18732                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18733                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18734                                  	; ds = cs
 18735 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18736 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18737                                  
 18738                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18739                                  ;else
 18740                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18741                                  ;
 18742                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18743                                  ;
 18744                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18745                                  
 18746 00000907 E86202                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 18747 0000090A F8                      	clc
 18748                                  mdhx:
 18749 0000090B C3                      	retn

 18806                                  ; procedure : MovDOS
 18807                                  ;
 18808                                  ;		Moves DOS code into requested area
 18809                                  ;
 18810                                  ;	In : ES:DI - pointer to memory where DOS is to be moved
 18811                                  ;	     CX    - size of DOS code to be moved
 18812                                  ;
 18813                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after DOS
 18814                                  ;
 18815                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18816                                  
 18817                                  	; 11/12/2022

 18824                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 18827                                  	; ds = cs

 18830                                  	;push	ds ; *//
 18831

 18834

 18837                                  
 18838                                  	; 29/04/2019
 18839 0000091B C536[6F02]              	lds	si,[dosinit] ; 11/12/2022
 18840                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18841                                  	;lds	si,[cs:dosinit]
 18842                                  	;;mov	ax,si
 18843

 18845                                  
 18846 00000921 1F                      	pop	ds ; *// ; 11/12/2022
 18847                                  
 18848 00000922 5B                      	pop	bx				; get back offset into which
 18849                                  						;  DOS was moved
 18850                                  
 18851 00000923 2EA1[6F02]              	mov	ax,[cs:dosinit]			; get the offset at which DOS
 18852                                  						;  wants to run
 18853 00000927 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx

 18856                                  						;  we moved DOS into

 18858                                  	
 18859                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18860                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18869                                  	;mov	[FINAL_DOS_LOCATION],bx
 18870                                  
 18871 00000933 C3                      	retn
 18872                                  
 18873                                  ;endif ;ROMDOS

 18978                                  
 18979                                  	pop	ds ; *// ; 11/12/2022

 19069                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19070                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19071                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19072                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19073                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19074                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19075                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19076                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19077                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19078                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19079                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19080                                  ;
 19081                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19082                                  
 19083                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19084                                  update_arena:
 19085 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19086 00000988 57                      	push	di
 19087 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 19088 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 19089                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19090                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19091                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19092                                  	; ds = cs 
 19093 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19094 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 19095 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19096                                  						;  before sysvar
 19097 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19098                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19099 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19100 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19101 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19102                                  
 19103                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19104 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19105 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19106 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19107 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19108 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19109                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19110 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19111                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19112 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19113 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19114                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19115 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19116 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19117                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19118                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19119 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19120 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19121 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 19122 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 19123 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19124 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 19125                                  ;
 19126                                  ; M012 : END
 19127                                  ;

 19145                                  ;
 19146                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19147                                  ;
 19148                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19149                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19150                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19151                                  ;
 19152                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19153                                  ;
 19154                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19155                                  
 19156                                  AllocHMA:
 19157                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19158                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19159                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19160                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19161                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19162                                  
 19163                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19164                                  ;
 19165                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19166                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19167                                  ;	push	ax
 19168                                  ;	popf
 19169                                  ;	pushf
 19170                                  ;	pop	ax
 19171                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19172                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19173                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19174                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19175                                  
 19176                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19177                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19178                                  
 19179 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 19180                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19181                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19182                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19183 000009CF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19184 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19185                                  
 19186 000009D4 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19187 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19188                                  
 19189 000009D9 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19190 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19191                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19192                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19193                                  
 19194 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19195                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19196 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19197                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19198                                  
 19199 000009E6 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19200 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19201                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19202 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19203 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 19204 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19205                                  
 19206                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19207                                  
 19208 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19209 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 19210                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19211                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19212                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19213 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19214                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19215                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19216 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19217                                  allocHMA_1:
 19218 000009FB B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19219                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19220 000009FD FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19221 00000A01 48                      	dec	ax
 19222 00000A02 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19223                                  
 19224 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19225 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19226                                  
 19227 00000A09 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19228 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19229 00000A0E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19230 00000A15 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19231                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19232                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19233 00000A1C 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19234                                  
 19235                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19236                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19237                                  ;	; cf=0
 19238                                  ;	;clc
 19239                                  ;	pop	ds
 19240                                  ;	retn
 19241                                  
 19242                                  grabhma_error:
 19243 00000A1E F9                      	stc

 19245                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19246                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19247 00000A1F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19248 00000A20 C3                      	retn
