 19314                                  
 19315                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19316                                  ;
 19317                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19318                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19319                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19320                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19321                                  ;
 19322                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19323                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19324                                  ;
 19325                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19326                                  
 19327                                  StartVDHead:
 19328                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19329                                  
 19330 00000A46 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19331 00000A4A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19332 00000A4C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19333 00000A4E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19334 00000A50 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19335                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19336 00000A51 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19337                                  VDiskSig1:
 19338 00000A58 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19339                                  
 19340                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19341                                  
 19342 00000A5D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19343                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19344 00000A63 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19345 00000A72 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19346 00000A74 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19347                                  VDInt19:
 19348 00000A75 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19349                                  OldVDInt19:
 19350 00000A76 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19351                                  
 19352                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19353                                  
 19354                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19355 00000A7A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19356                                  VDiskSig2:
 19357 00000A7D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19358                                  
 19359                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19360                                  
 19361 00000A82 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19362 00000A85 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19363 00000A87 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19364 00000A88 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19365 00000A8A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19366 00000A8B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19367 00000A8D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19368 00000A8F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19369 00000A90 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19370 00000A92 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19371 00000A94 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19372 00000A96 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19373 00000A98 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19374                                  
 19375                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19376                                  
 19377                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19378                                  ;
 19379                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19380                                  ;
 19381                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19382                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19383                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19384                                  ;
 19385                                  ; Inputs : None
 19386                                  ;
 19387                                  ; Outputs : None
 19388                                  ;
 19389                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19390                                  ;
 19391                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19392                                  
 19393                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19394                                  
 19395                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19396 00000A9A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19397 00000A9C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19398                                  
 19399                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19400                                  
 19401                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19402 00000A9E A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19403                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19404 00000AA1 2EA3[760A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19405 00000AA5 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19406                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19407 00000AA8 2EA3[780A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19408                                  
 19409                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19410

 19513                                  
 19514                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19515                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19516                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19517                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19518                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19519                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19520                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19521                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19522                                  ;								      ;I070
 19523                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19524                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19525                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19526                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19527                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19528                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19529                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19530                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19531                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19532                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19533                                  ;								      ;I070
 19534                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19535                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19536                                  
 19537                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19538                                  	; ds = cs

 19580                                  ;		the offset.

 20271                                  ;*******************************************************************************
 20272                                  ;									       *
 20273                                  ; function: actually allocate buffers in the memory and initialize it. 	       *
 20274                                  ; input :								       *
 20275                                  ;    memhi:memlo - start of the next available memory			       *
 20276                                  ;    buffers = number of buffers					       *
 20277                                  ;    h_buffers = number of secondary buffers				       *
 20278                                  ;									       *
 20279                                  ; output:								       *
 20280                                  ;	buffinfo.cache_count - # of caches to be installed.		       *
 20281                                  ;	buffinfo set.							       *

 20283                                  ;									       *
 20284                                  ; subroutines to be called:						       *
 20285                                  ;									       *
 20286                                  ;*******************************************************************************

 20288                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 20533                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20534                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20535                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20536                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20537                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20538                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20539                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20540                                  ;
 20541                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20542                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20543                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20544                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20545                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20546                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20547                                  ;
 20548                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20549                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20550                                  ;
 20551                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20552                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20553                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20554                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20555                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20556                                  ;
 20557                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20558                                  ;
 20559                                  ;			  none.
 20560                                  
 20561                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20562                                  ;
 20563                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20564                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20565

 20742 00001025 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 20743 00001026 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 20744 00001028 CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 20745                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 20746                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 20747                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 20748 0000102A BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 20749 0000102D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20750 0000102F CD21                    	int	21h
 20751 00001031 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20752 00001033 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 20753                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 20754                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 20755 00001035 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 20756                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 20757 00001038 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 20758 0000103C B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 20759 0000103E CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 20760                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 20761                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 20762                                  endfile_ret:
 20763 00001040 C3                      	retn
 20764                                  
 20765                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.
 20766                                  
 20767                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20768                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20769                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20770                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20771                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20772                                  ;
 20773                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20774                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20775                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20776                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20777                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20778                                  ; program).
 20779                                  
 20780                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20781                                  
 20782                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20783                                  
 20784 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20785                                  
 20786                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20787                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20788                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20789                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20790                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20791                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20792                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20793                                  ; carridge return.
 20794                                  
 20795                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20796                                  ;character after =.
 20797                                  
 20798 00001042 06                      	push	es
 20799 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20800 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20801 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20802 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20803                                  
 20804 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20805 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20806 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20807 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20808                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20809 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20810 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20811 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20812 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20813                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20814 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20815 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20816 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20817 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20818 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20819 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20820 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20821                                  done_installparm:
 20822 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20823 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20824 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20825 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20826                                  					; starts with cr.
 20827                                  install_seg_set:
 20828 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20829 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 20830                                  
 20831                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 20832                                  ;
 20833                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 20834                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 20835                                  ;
 20836                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 20837                                  ;
 20838                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 20839                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 20840                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 20841                                  ;
 20842                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20843                                  
 20844                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 20845                                  
 20846                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 20847                                  
 20848                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20849                                          ;mov     cx,ax
 20850                                          ;cmp     word [cs:config_envlen],0
 20851                                          ;je      short no_envdata2
 20852                                          ;mov     cx,[cs:config_wrkseg]
 20853                                  ;no_envdata2:
 20854                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 20855                                  
 20856                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_environ],cx ; set the environment seg.
 20857                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20858                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 20859                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20860 00001081 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 20861                                  
 20862                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 20863 00001085 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 20864                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20865 00001089 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20866                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20867 0000108D 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20868 00001091 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 20869 00001094 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 20870 00001098 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20871 0000109A B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 20872 0000109C BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 20873 0000109F 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 20874 000010A0 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 20875 000010A1 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 20876                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 20877                                  
 20878                                  ;----------------------------------------
 20879                                  
 20880                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 20881                                  
 20882                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20883                                  
 20884                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 20885 000010A6 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 20886 000010A7 06                      	push	es
 20887 000010A8 1E                      	push	ds
 20888 000010A9 07                      	pop	es
 20889 000010AA 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 20890 000010AB 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 20891                                  
 20892 000010AD 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 20893 000010AE E8AF22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 20894 000010B1 5E                      	pop	si
 20895                                  
 20896                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20897                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 20898                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20899                                  	; ds = cs
 20900 000010B2 C3                      	retn
 20901                                  
 20902                                  install_exit_ret:
 20903                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 20904                                  
 20905                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20906                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 20907 000010B3 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 20908 000010B5 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 20909 000010B7 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 20910 000010BA 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 20911 000010BC E89316                  	call    error_line
 20912 000010BF F9                      	stc
 20913                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 20914 000010C0 C3                      	retn

 20916                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20917                                  
 20918                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20919                                  ;
 20920                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20921                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20922                                  ;
 20923                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20924                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20925                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20926                                  
 20927                                  ParaRound:
 20928 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20929 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20930 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20931 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20932 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20933 000010CC C3                      	retn
 20934                                  
 20935                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20936                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20937                                  ;
 20938                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20939                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20940                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20941                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20942                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20943                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20944                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20945                                  ;
 20946                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20947                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20948                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20949                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20950                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20951                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20952                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20953                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20954                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20955                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20956                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20957                                  ;
 20958                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20959                                  
 20960                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20961                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20962                                  sysinit_base:				
 20963 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20964 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20965 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20966 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20967 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20968 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20969 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20970 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20971                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20972                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20973 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20974 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20975 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20976                                  
 20977                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20978                                  
 20979 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20980 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 20981 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 20982 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20983 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 20984                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20985                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20986                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20987                                  _stall: 
 20988                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20989 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 20990                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20991                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 20992 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 20993                                  
 20994                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 20995 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 20996                                  
 20997                                  ;-------------------------------------
 20998                                  
 20999                                  sum_up:
 21000                                  
 21001                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21002                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21003                                  ;
 21004                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21005                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21006                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21007                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21008                                  ;
 21009                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21010                                  
 21011 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21012                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21013                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21014 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21015 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21016 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21017 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21018 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21019                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21020 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21021 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21022                                  sum1:
 21023 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21024 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21025 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21026 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21027                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21028                                  sum_sys_code:
 21029                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21030 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21031                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21032                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21033                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21034                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21035                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21036                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21037                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21038 0000111F B9[F038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21039 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21040 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21041                                  sum2:
 21042 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21043 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21044 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21045 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21046 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21047 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21048                                  
 21049                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21050                                  
 21051                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21052                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21053 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 21054                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21055                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21056 00001131 0000                    	dw	0
 21057                                  
 21058                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21059

 21061

 21070                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21071                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21072                                  ;
 21073                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21074                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21075                                  ;
 21076                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21077                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21078                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21079                                  ;
 21080                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21081                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21082                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21083                                  
 21084                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21085                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21086                                  
 21087                                  set_buffer:
 21088 0000114E 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21089 00001150 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21090 00001153 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21091 00001155 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21092                                  set_buff_1:
 21093                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21094                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21095 00001157 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21096                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21097 00001159 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21098                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21099 0000115C C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21100                                  
 21101 00001161 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21102 00001163 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21103 00001168 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21104                                  
 21105                                  ;	for each buffer
 21106                                  
 21107                                  nxt_buff:
 21108 00001169 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...

 21110 0000116E E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21111

 21113

 21115                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21116 00001176 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21117 00001179 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21118                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21119                                  	; 25/10/2022

 21121                                  
 21122 0000117F 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21123 00001181 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21124                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21125 00001183 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21126 00001187 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21127                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21128 0000118B C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21129                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21130 00001190 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21131 00001193 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21132                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21133 00001197 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21134                                  set_buff_2:
 21135 0000119A 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax

 21137 0000119F 2E800E[3614]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21143                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21144                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21145                                  ;
 21146                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21147                                  ;
 21148                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21149                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21150                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21151                                  
 21152                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21153                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21154 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 21155 000011A9 52                      	push	dx
 21156 000011AA 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21157 000011AE 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21158                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21159 000011B3 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21160                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21161                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21162                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21163 000011B6 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21164 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21165 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21166                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21167 000011BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21168 000011BF 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21169 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21170 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21171                                  	;zf=1
 21172                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21173                                  	;zf=1
 21174 000011C7 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21175                                  got_hma:
 21176 000011CC 5A                      	pop	dx
 21177 000011CD 5B                      	pop	bx
 21178 000011CE C3                      	retn
 21179                                  
 21180                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21181                                  
 21182                                  set_buffer_info:
 21183                                  
 21184                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21185                                  ;
 21186                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21187                                  ;    ax = di
 21188                                  ;
 21189                                  ;out:
 21190                                  ;    above entries set.
 21191                                  
 21192                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21193 000011CF 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21194                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21195 000011D4 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21196 000011D8 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21197 000011DC 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21198                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21199 000011E1 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21200                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21201 000011E4 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21202                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21203 000011EA 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21204                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21205 000011F0 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 21207                                  
 21208                                  ; ======================================================================
 21209                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21210                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21211                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21212                                  
 21213                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21214                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21215                                  ;
 21216                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21217                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21218                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21219                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21220                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21221                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21222                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21223                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21224                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21225                                  ;
 21226                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21227                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21228                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21229                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21230                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21231                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21232                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21233                                  ;	conditions:
 21234                                  ;
 21235                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21236                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21237                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21238                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21239                                  ;
 21240                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21241                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21242                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21243                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21244                                  ;
 21245                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21246                                  ;
 21247                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21248                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21249                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21250                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21251                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21252                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21253                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21254                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21255                                  ;
 21256                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21257                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21258                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21259                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21260                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21261                                  ;
 21262                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21263                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21264                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21265                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21266                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21267                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21268                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21269                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21270                                  ;
 21271                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21272                                  
 21273                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21274                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21275                                  
 21276                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21277                                  stackinit:
 21278 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21279 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21280 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21281 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21282 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21283 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21284 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21285 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21286 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21287                                  
 21288                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21289                                  
 21290                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21291                                  	; ds = cs
 21292 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21293 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21294                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21295                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21296                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21297 00001205 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21298                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21299 00001209 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21300 0000120C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21301                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21302 00001210 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21303                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21304                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21305                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21306 00001213 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21307                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21308 00001217 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21309 00001219 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21310                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21311                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21312                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21313 0000121C 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21314                                  
 21315                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21316                                  
 21317                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21318                                  
 21319                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21320                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21321                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21322 00001220 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21323

 21325                                  
 21326 00001225 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8

 21331 0000122A 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21332 0000122C 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax

 21335

 21337                                  
 21338 00001235 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]

 21341 00001240 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21342 00001242 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 21344 00001245 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21345                                  
 21346                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21347                                  
 21348 00001246 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21349 0000124A FC                      	cld
 21350 0000124B F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21351                                  
 21352 0000124D 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21353                                  
 21354                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21355                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21356                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21357                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21358                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 22108                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22109                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22110                                  
 22111                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22112                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22113                                  
 22114                                  new_init_loop:
 22115                                  
 22116                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22117                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22118                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22119                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22120                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22121                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22122                                  
 22123 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22124 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22125 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22126 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22127                                  
 22128 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22129                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22130                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22131                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22132 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22133 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22134 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22135 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22136 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22137 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22138 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22139                                  
 22140 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22141 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22142 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22143                                  
 22144                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22145                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22146                                  
 22147                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22148                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22149                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22150                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22151                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22152                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22153                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22154                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22155                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22156                                  
 22157                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22158                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22159                                  
 22160                                  setdevmark:
 22161                                  
 22162 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22163 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22164                                  
 22165 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22166 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22167 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22168                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22169                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22170 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22171 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 22172                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22173 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22174                                  
 22175 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 22176 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 22177 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22178 00001432 C3                      	retn
 22179

 22378                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22379                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22380                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22381                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22382                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22383                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22384                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22385                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22386                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22387                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22388                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22389                                  
 22390                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22391                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22392 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22393 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22394 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22395                                  endstruc
 22396                                  
 22397                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22398                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22399                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22400                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22401                                  
 22402                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22403                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22404                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22405                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22406                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22407                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22408                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22409                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22410                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22411                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22412                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22413                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22414                                  
 22415                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22416                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22417 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22418 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22419 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22420                                  endstruc
 22421                                  
 22422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22423                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22424                                  ;
 22425                                  ;
 22426                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22427                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22428                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22429                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22430                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22431                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22432                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22433                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22434                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22435                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22436                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22437                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22438                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22439                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22440                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22441                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22442                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22443                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22444                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22445                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22446                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22447                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22448                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22449                                  ;	   :
 22450                                  ;
 22451                                  ;Note:
 22452                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22453                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22454                                  ;
 22455                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22456                                  ;
 22457                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22458                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22459                                  ;
 22460                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22461                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22462                                  ;
 22463                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22464                                  ;
 22465                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22466                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22467                                  ;
 22468                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22469                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22470                                  ;
 22471                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22472                                  ;
 22473                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22474                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22475                                  ;
 22476                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22477                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22478                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22479                                  ;
 22480                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22481                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22482                                  ;
 22483                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22484                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22485                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22486                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22487                                  
 22488                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22489                                  
 22490                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22491                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22492                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22493                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22494                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22495                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22496                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22497                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22498                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22499                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22500                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22501                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22502                                  
 22503                                  ;**** Function flags
 22504                                  
 22505                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22506                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22507                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22508                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22509                                  
 22510                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22511                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22512 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22513 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22514 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22515 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22516 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22517 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22518                                  endstruc
 22519                                  
 22520                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22521                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22522                                  ;
 22523                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22524                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22525                                  ;	     +-
 22526                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22527                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22528                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22529                                  ;	     |	:
 22530                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22531                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22532                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22533                                  ;	     |	:
 22534                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22535                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22536                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22537                                  ;	     +-	:
 22538                                  ;
 22539                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22540                                  ;
 22541                                  ;Note:
 22542                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22543                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22544                                  ;
 22545                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22546                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22547                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22548                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22549                                  
 22550                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22551                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22552                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22553                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22554                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22555                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22556                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22557                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22558                                  
 22559                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22560 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22561 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22562 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22563 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22564 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22565                                  endstruc
 22566                                  
 22567                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22568                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22569                                  ;
 22570                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22571                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22572                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22573                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22574                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22575                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22576                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22577                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22578                                  ;
 22579                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22580                                  ;
 22581                                  ;            +-
 22582                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22583                                  ;	    | or
 22584                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22585                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22586                                  ;	    | or
 22587                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22588                                  ;	    | or
 22589                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22590                                  ;	    | or
 22591                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22592                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22593                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22594                                  ;	    | or
 22595                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22596                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22597                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22598                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22599                                  ;	    +-
 22600                                  ;
 22601                                  ;
 22602                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22603                                  ;      list.
 22604                                  ;
 22605                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22606                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22607                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22608                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22609                                  
 22610                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22611                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22612 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22613 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22614 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22615 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22616                                  endstruc

 22629                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22630                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 22639                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22640                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22641                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22642                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22643                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22644                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22645                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22646                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22647                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line
