 22661 00001448 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 22662                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 22663                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only

 22678                                  
 22679 0000144A 0000                    _$P_SaveSI_Cmpx:   dw	0		;AN000; save si for later use by complex

 22731                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22732                                  ; SysParse;
 22733                                  ;
 22734                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22735                                  ;
 22736                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22737                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22738                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22739                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22740                                  ;
 22741                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22742                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22743                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22744                                  ;
 22745                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22746                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22747                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22748                                  ;
 22749                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22750                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22751                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22752                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22753                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22754                                  ;
 22755                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22756                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22757                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22758                                  ;
 22759                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22760                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22761                                  ;
 22762                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22763                                  ;
 22764                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22765                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22766                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22767                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22768                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22769                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22770                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22771                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22772                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22773                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22774                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22775                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22776                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22777                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22778                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22779                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22780                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22781                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22782                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22783                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22784                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22785                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22786                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22787                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22788                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22789                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22790                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22791                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22792                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22793                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22794                                  
 22795                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22796                                  
 22797                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22798                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22799                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22800                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22801                                  
 22802                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22803                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22804                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22805                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22806                                  ;
 22807                                  
 22808                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22809                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22810                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22811                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22812                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22813                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22814                                  
 22815                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22816                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22817                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22818                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22819                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22820                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22821                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22822                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22823                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22824                                  
 22825                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22826                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22827                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22828                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22829                                  ;	     segment.
 22830                                  
 22831                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22832                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22833                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22834                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22835                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22836                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22837                                  
 22838                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22839                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22840                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 22841                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 22842                                  
 22843                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 22844                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT

 22847                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 22848                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove

 22851                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 22852                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22853                                  
 22854                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22855                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 22856                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 22857                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 22858                                  
 22859                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 22860                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 22861

 22863

 22939                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.

 22941                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.

 23356                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23357                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23358                                  ;
 23359                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23360                                  ;
 23361                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23362                                  ;	    AL = type
 23363                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23364                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23365                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23366                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23367                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23368                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23369                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23370                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23371                                  ;
 23372                                  ; Output:   None
 23373                                  ;
 23374                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23375                                  ;
 23376                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23377                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23378                                  
 23379                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23385 0000172C 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 23386 00001730 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 23389                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 23390 00001739 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23391                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 23392 0000173A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 23393 0000173C 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 23394

 23746                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23747                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23748                                  ;
 23749                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23750                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23751                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23752                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23753                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23754                                  ;
 23755                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23756                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23757                                  ;
 23758                                  ; Output:    None
 23759                                  ;
 23760                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23761                                  ;
 23762                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23763                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23764                                  
 23765                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23766                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23767                                  
 23768                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23769 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23770 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23771 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23772 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23773 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23774 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23775                                  
 23776 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23777 000018F1 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23778                                  
 23779 000018F3 2E800E[4914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23780                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23781 000018F9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23782                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23783 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23784 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23785 000018FE C3                      	retn
 23786                                  
 23787                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23788                                  
 23789                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23790                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 23791 000018FF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23792 00001900 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23793 00001901 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23794 00001902 56                      	push	si			;AN000;

 23796 00001905 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 23797 00001907 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 23798                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 23799 00001908 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23800 0000190B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 23801 0000190D 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 23802                                  
 23803 0000190F E8F000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 23804 00001912 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 23805                                  
 23806 00001914 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;

 23980                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23981                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 23982                                  ;
 23983                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 23984                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 23985                                  ;
 23986                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 23987                                  ;
 23988                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 23989                                  ;
 23990                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 23991                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23992                                  
 23993                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23994                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 23995 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 23996 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 23997 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 23998                                  
 23999 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24000 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24001                                  
 24002                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24003 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24004 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24005                                  
 24006 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24007 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24008                                  
 24009                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24010 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24011 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24563 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24564                                  
 24565                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24566 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24567 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24568                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24569                                  
 24570 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24571                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24572 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24573                                  
 24574 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24575 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24576                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24577 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24578 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24579 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24580                                  
 24581                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24582 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24583 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24584                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24585 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24586 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24587 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24588                                  
 24589 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24590                                  
 24591                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24592 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24593                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24594 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24595 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24596 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24597                                  
 24598                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24599                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24600                                  ;
 24601                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24602                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24603                                  ;	    blanks.
 24604                                  ;
 24605                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24606                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24607                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24608                                  ;
 24609                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24610                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24611                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24612                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24613                                  
 24614                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24615 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24616 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24617 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24618                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24619                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24620 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24621 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24622 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24623                                  
 24624 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24625 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24626                                  
 24627 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24628 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24629                                  
 24630                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24631                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24632 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24633 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24634                                  
 24635 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24636 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24637                                  
 24638 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24639 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24640 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24641 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24642                                  
 24643                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24644 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24645                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24646 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24647                                  
 24648                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24649 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24650                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24651 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24652                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24653 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24654 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24655                                  
 24656 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24657                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24658 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24659 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24660 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24661                                  
 24662 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24663                                  
 24664                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24665 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24666                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24667                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24668 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24669 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24670 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24671                                  
 24672                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24673 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24674 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24675 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24676                                  
 24677 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24678                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24679                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24680 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24681 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24682                                  
 24683                                  
 24684                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24685                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24686                                  ;
 24687                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24688                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24689                                  ;
 24690                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24691                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24692                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24693                                  ;
 24694                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24695                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24696                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24697                                  
 24698                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24699                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24700                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24701                                  ;
 24702                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24703                                  
 24704                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24705                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24706                                  
 24707                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24708                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24709 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24710                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24711 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24712 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24713                                  
 24714                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24715 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24716 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24717                                  
 24718 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24719                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24720                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24721 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24722                                  
 24723                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24724                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24725                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24726                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24727                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24728                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24729                                  
 24730                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24731                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24732 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24733 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24734                                  
 24735 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24736                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24737                                  
 24738                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24739                                  	; cf=0
 24740                                  	;retn
 24741                                  
 24742                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24743                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24744                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24745 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24746                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24747                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24748 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24749                                  
 24750                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24751                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24752                                  ;
 24753                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24754                                  ;
 24755                                  ;  Input:
 24756                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24757                                  ;
 24758                                  ;  Output:
 24759                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24760                                  ;
 24761                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24762                                  ;
 24763                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24764                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24765                                  
 24766                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24767 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24768 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24769 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24770                                  	
 24771 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24772 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24773                                  
 24774 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24775 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24776 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24777 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24778 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24779 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24780 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24781 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24782 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24783 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24784 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24785                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24786 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24787 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24788 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24789 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24790 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24791 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24792 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24793 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24794 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24795 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24796                                  
 24797                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24798 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24799 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24800                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24801 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24802 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24803                                  
 24804                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24805 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24806 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24807                                  
 24808 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24809 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24810                                  
 24811 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24812 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24813                                  
 24814 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24815 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24816                                  
 24817                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24818 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24819 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24820                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24821 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24822                                  
 24823                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24824                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24825                                  	; cf=0
 24826                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24827                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24828 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24829 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24830 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24831 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25383                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25384                                  
 25385                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25386                                  
 25387                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25388                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25389                                  
 25390                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25391                                  ;
 25392                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25393                                  ;
 25394                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25395                                  ;
 25396                                  ;   Modification log:
 25397                                  ;
 25398                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25399                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25400                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25401                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25402                                  ;
 25403                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25404                                  ;
 25405                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25406                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25407                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25408                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25409                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25410                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25411                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25412                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25413                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25414                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25415                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25416                                  ;
 25417                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25418                                  
 25419                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25420                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25421                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25422                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25423                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25424                                  
 25425                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25426                                  
 25427                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25428                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25429                                  
 25430                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25431                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25432                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25433                                  
 25434                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25435                                  ;
 25436                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25437                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25438                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25439                                  ;	           line.
 25440                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25441                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25442                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25443                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25444                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25445                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25446                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25447                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25448                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25449                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25450                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25451                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25452                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25453                                  ;	           for details).
 25454                                  
 25455                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25456                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25457                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25458                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25459                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25460                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25461                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25462                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25463                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25464                                  
 25465                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25466                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25467                                  
 25468                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25469                                  
 25470                                  %endif
 25471

 25482 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25483 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25484 00001EEE 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25485 00001EF0 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25486 00001EF4 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25487                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25488                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25489                                  ;
 25490 00001EF8 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25491 00001EF9 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25492 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25493 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25494                                  ;
 25495 00001EFF 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25496                                  ;
 25497 00001F03 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25498 00001F05 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25499                                  ;
 25500 00001F07 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25501                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25502 00001F08 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25503                                  ;
 25504 00001F0A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25505 00001F0B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25506 00001F0D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25507                                  ;
 25508 00001F15 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25509 00001F16 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data

 25511 00001F1C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null

 25527                                  ; procedure : doconf

 25564                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)

 25577                                  
 25578                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25579                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25580 00001F4E 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25581

 25583 00001F55 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25584 00001F58 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25585 00001F5B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25586                                  
 25587                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25588                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25589                                  ;;
 25590                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25591                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25592                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25593                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25594                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25595                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25596                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25597                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25598                                  ;;
 25599                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25600                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25601                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25602                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25603                                  
 25604 00001F5D 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25605                                  	
 25606                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25607                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25608                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25609 00001F60 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25610 00001F64 E870EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25611                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25612                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25613 00001F67 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25614                                   
 25615 00001F6C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25616 00001F6E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25617                                  
 25618 00001F70 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25619 00001F72 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25620 00001F77 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25621                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25622 00001F79 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25623 00001F7A CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25624 00001F7C 9C                      	pushf
 25625                                  
 25626                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25627                                  
 25628 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25629 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25630 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25631 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25632 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25633 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25634 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25635 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25636                                  
 25637                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25638                                  
 25639 00001F8A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25640                                  
 25641                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25642                                  
 25643                                  puteol:
 25644 00001F8B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25645 00001F8D AA                      	stosb
 25646 00001F8E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25647 00001F90 AA                      	stosb
 25648 00001F91 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25649                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25650                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25651                                  
 25652                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25653                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25654 00001F93 0E                      	push	cs
 25655 00001F94 1F                      	pop	ds
 25656                                  
 25657 00001F95 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25658                                  
 25659 00001F99 59                      	pop	cx
 25660 00001F9A 5F                      	pop	di
 25661 00001F9B 58                      	pop	ax
 25662                                  
 25663                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25664                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25665                                  	;push	cs
 25666                                  	;pop	ds
 25667                                  
 25668 00001F9C 50                      	push	ax
 25669                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25670 00001F9D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25671 00001F9F CD21                    	int	21h
 25672 00001FA1 58                      	pop	ax
 25673 00001FA2 9D                      	popf
 25674 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25675 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25676 00001FA7 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25677                                  conferr:
 25678 00001FA9 BA[0534]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25679 00001FAC E8AD13                  	call	badfil
 25680                                  endconv:
 25681 00001FAF C3                      	retn
 25682                                  
 25683                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25684                                  ;
 25685                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25686                                  ;
 25687                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25688                                  ;
 25689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25690                                  
 25691                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25692                                  multi_pass:
 25693 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25694 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25695                                  
 25696 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25697                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25698 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25699                                  
 25700                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25701                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25702 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25703 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25704                                  
 25705 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25706 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25707 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25708 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25709 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25710                                  
 25711 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25712 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25713                                  
 25714                                  getcom:
 25715 00001FD5 E8B20E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25716 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25717                                  conflp: 
 25718 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25719                                  
 25720 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25721                                  
 25722 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25723 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25724 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25725 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25726                                  
 25727                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25728                                  %if 0
 25729                                  
 25730                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25731                                  
 25732                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25733                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25734                                  
 25735                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25736                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25737                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25738                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25739                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25740                                  
 25741                                          push    ax                      ;
 25742                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25743                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25744                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25745                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25746                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25747                                          pop     ax
 25748                                  ;
 25749                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25750                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25751                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25752                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25753                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25754                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25755                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25756                                  ;   spot.
 25757                                  ;
 25758                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25759                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25760                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25761                                  ;   retrieved.
 25762                                  ;
 25763                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25764                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25765                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25766                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25767                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25768                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25769                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25770                                  final:                                  ;
 25771                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25772                                  not_final:                              ;
 25773                                  ;endif
 25774                                  
 25775                                  %endif
 25776 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25777 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25778 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25779                                  
 25780 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25781                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25782                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25783 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25784 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25785                                  	
 25786                                  coff:	
 25787                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25788                                  	; ds = cs
 25789                                  	;push	cs
 25790                                  	;pop	ds
 25791 00002000 E89E10                  	call	newline
 25792 00002003 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 25793                                  
 25794                                  blank_line:
 25795 00002005 E83307                  	call	getchr
 25796 00002008 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 25797                                  
 25798                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25799                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25800                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25801                                  ;coff_p:
 25802                                  	;push	cs
 25803                                  	;pop	ds
 25804                                  
 25805                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25806                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25807                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25808                                  ;install= command.
 25809                                  
 25810                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25811                                  ;install command
 25812                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25813                                  
 25814                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25815                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25816                                  tryi:
 25817 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25818 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25819 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25820                                  not_init_pass:
 25821 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25822                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25823                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25824 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25825                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25826                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25827                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25828                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25829                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25830                                  					; and before install= commands
 25831                                  					; are processed
 25832                                  
 25833 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25834 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25835 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25836                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25837                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25838 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25839                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25840                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25841                                  
 25842                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25843                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25844                                          
 25845 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25846                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25847                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25848 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25849                                  	
 25850                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25851 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25852                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25853 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25854                                  
 25855                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25856                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25857                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25858                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25859                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25860                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25861                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 25862                                  
 25863                                  multi_try_i:
 25864 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 25865                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 25866                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25867 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25868                                  
 25869                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25870                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25871                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25872                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25873                                  ;;endif
 25874                                  
 25875 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25876 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 25877                                  
 25878                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25879                                  %if 0
 25880                                  
 25881                                  multi_try_n:
 25882                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25883                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25884                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25885                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25886                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25887                                  ;endif
 25888                                  
 25889                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25890                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25891                                  
 25892                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25893                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25894                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25895                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25896                                  
 25897                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25898                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25899                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25900                                  
 25901                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25902                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25903                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25904                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25905                                  
 25906                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25907                                  	mov	bx,1
 25908                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25909                                  
 25910                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25911                                  
 25912                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25913                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25914                                          int     21h
 25915                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25916                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25917                                          int     21h
 25918                                  
 25919                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25920                                  
 25921                                  %endif
 25922                                  
 25923                                  multi_pass_filter:
 25924 0000203D 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 25925 00002040 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25926 00002042 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 25927 00002045 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25928 00002047 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 25929 0000204A 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 25930                                  
 25931                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 25932 0000204C FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 25933 00002050 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 25934                                  
 25935                                  multi_pass_coff:
 25936                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25937 00002054 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 25938                                  
 25939                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25940                                  ; buffer command
 25941                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25942                                  
 25943                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25944                                  ;									      *
 25945                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25946                                  ;									      *
 25947                                  ; input :								      *
 25948                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25949                                  ; output:								      *
 25950                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25951                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 25952                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 25953                                  ;									      *
 25954                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 25955                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 25956                                  ; logic:								      *
 25957                                  ; {									      *
 25958                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 25959                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 25960                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 25961                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 25962                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 25963                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 25964                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 25965                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 25966                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 25967                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 25968                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 25969                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 25970                                  ;	};								      *
 25971                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
